alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Isle of Wight , the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the western City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 230 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Isle Of Wight, or near Windsor, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Smithfield around 205 PM EDT. Kings Fork around 210 PM EDT. Churchland, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Crittenden, Driver, Western Branch and Bowers Hill around 230 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Fox Hill, Carrollton, Phoebus, Langley View, Longview, Benns Church, Huntersville, Wills Corner, Bethel Church and Hilton Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk
